modules.description: This module defines float-based weights for an urn system, supporting arithmetic operations and random sampling. It provides `compare`, `zero`, `add`, `sub`, and `sample` functions tailored to `float` values using `Random.float` for sampling. Concrete use cases include implementing weighted random selection with floating-point precision, such as simulating probabilistic distributions or managing weighted item pools.

This module defines operations for integer weights in an urn used for weighted random sampling. It provides functions to compare, add, subtract, and sample integer weights, ensuring correct behavior for random selection. It is used to implement weighted random sampling where weights are integers, such as selecting items from a list with specified probabilities.

This module creates an urn structure for weighted random sampling, supporting operations to construct, modify, and sample from urns with precise control over element weights. It works with a totally ordered group weight type and stores elements of any type paired with those weights. Concrete use cases include implementing stochastic algorithms, simulating probabilistic events, and managing dynamic weighted populations where elements are added, removed, or updated frequently.

This module implements an urn data structure for weighted random sampling, supporting dynamic insertion, removal, and weight updates of elements. It operates on elements paired with weights from a totally ordered group, such as integers or floats, and enables efficient sampling based on those weights. Concrete use cases include simulating probabilistic events with changing likelihoods, implementing stochastic algorithms, and managing weighted pools of items where elements are frequently modified.
